org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.its.crypto

Class DefaultCryptoManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.its.crypto.DefaultCryptoManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CryptoManager

    public class DefaultCryptoManager
extends Object
implements CryptoManager
    Default implementation of ITS CryptoManager with support for public key algorithms: ecdsa_nistp256_with_sha256 and ecies_nistp256
    Author:
    Philip Vendil, p.vendil@cgi.com

                     throws IllegalArgumentException,
                            NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                            NoSuchProviderException,
                            IOException,
                            BadCredentialsException
        Initialized Bouncycastle and it's specific key factories
        Specified by:
        setupAndConnect in interface CryptoManager
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if supplied parameters contained invalid data.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if required underlying cryptographic algorithms doesn't exist in JVM.
        NoSuchProviderException - if required cryptographic providers couldn't be found in JVM.
        IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.
        BadCredentialsException - if supplied credentials wasn't successful when authentication towards underlying hardware.

      • encryptSecureMessage

        public SecuredMessage encryptSecureMessage(SecuredMessage secureMessage,
                                  PublicKeyAlgorithm encryptionAlg,
                                  List<Certificate> receipients)
                                    throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                           GeneralSecurityException,
                                           IOException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoManager
        Message to encrypt a securedmessage to a list of recepients. This method will encrypt all payloads with payload type 'encrypted'. To construct an encrypted message you should first generate the message and add payloads with encrypted type and cleartext data, then call this method which will replace the data with encrypted equivalent.
        Specified by:
        encryptSecureMessage in interface CryptoManager
        Parameters:
        secureMessage - the secure message to encrypt.
        encryptionAlg - the encryption algorithm to use.
        receipients - a list of certificates of recipients, must have a encryption key specified in each certificate.
        Returns:
        A SecureMessage with it's payload encrypted.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if supplied arguments was invalid, such as one of the recipients certificates didn't have an encryption key..
        GeneralSecurityException - if internal problems occurred encrypting the message.
        IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components
        See Also:
        CryptoManager.encryptSecureMessage(SecuredMessage, PublicKeyAlgorithm, List)

      • encryptSecureMessage

      • encryptAndSignSecureMessage

        public SecuredMessage encryptAndSignSecureMessage(SecuredMessage secureMessage,
                                         Certificate signerCertificate,
                                         SignerInfoType signInfoType,
                                         PublicKeyAlgorithm signAlg,
                                         PrivateKey signPrivateKey,
                                         PublicKeyAlgorithm encryptionAlg,
                                         List<Certificate> receipients)
                                           throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                  GeneralSecurityException,
                                                  IOException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoManager
        Method to sign and encrypt a secured message using the given algorithm and private keys and returns another message with an attached signature according to the ITS specification with EccPointType x_coordinate_only containing the R value.

        This method will only encrypt payload with type signed_and_encrypted

        Important: This method will add signing and encryption header to the message automatically and it doesn't need to be added manually.

        Specified by:
        encryptAndSignSecureMessage in interface CryptoManager
        Parameters:
        secureMessage - the message data to sign and encrypt.
        signerCertificate - the certificate used when signing.
        signInfoType - indicates the type of SignerInfo inserted into generated messages, supported values are: certificate_digest_with_ecdsap256 or certificate.
        signAlg - the signing public key algorithm scheme to use.
        signPrivateKey - the private key used to sign the message.
        encryptionAlg - encryption algorithm to use.
        receipients - a list of certificates of recipients, must have a encryption key specified in each certificate.
        Returns:
        the message ITS Signature data structure containing the generated signature attached.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if supplied arguments was invalid.
        GeneralSecurityException - if internal problems occurred encrypting or generating the signature.
        IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.
        See Also:
        org.certificateservices.custom.c2x.its.crypto.CryptoManager#signAndEncryptSecureMessage(SecuredMessage, Certificate, SignerInfoType, PublicKeyAlgorithm, PrivateKey, PublicKeyAlgorithm, List)

                                  Certificate receiverCertificate,
                                  PrivateKey receiverKey)
                                    throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                           GeneralSecurityException,
                                           IOException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoManager

        Parameters:

        receiverCertificate - the certificate for the private key used for decryption.
        receiverKey - the private key used to decrypt the message.
        Returns:

        Throws:

        GeneralSecurityException - if internal problems occurred decrypting the message.
        IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components

      • signSecureMessage

        public SecuredMessage signSecureMessage(SecuredMessage secureMessage,
                               Certificate signerCertificate,
                               SignerInfoType signerInfoType,
                               PublicKeyAlgorithm alg,
                               PrivateKey privateKey)
                                 throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                        SignatureException,
                                        IOException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoManager
        Method to sign a secured message using the given algorithm and private key and returns the same message with an attached signature according to the ITS specification with EccPointType x_coordinate_only containing the R value.

        Important: This method will add signed info header to the message automatically and it doesn't need to be added manually.

        Specified by:
        signSecureMessage in interface CryptoManager
        Parameters:
        secureMessage - the message data to sign.
        signerCertificate - the certificate used when signing.
        signerInfoType - indicates the type of SignerInfo inserted into generated messages, supported values are: certificate_digest_with_ecdsap256 or certificate.
        alg - the public key algorithm scheme to use.
        privateKey - the private key used to sign the message.
        Returns:
        the message ITS Signature data structure containing the generated signature attached.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if supplied arguments was invalid.
        SignatureException - if internal problems occurred generating the signature.
        IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.
        See Also:
        CryptoManager.signSecureMessage(SecuredMessage, Certificate, SignerInfoType, PublicKeyAlgorithm, PrivateKey)

      • verifyCertificate

        public boolean verifyCertificate(Certificate certificate)
                          throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                 SignatureException,
                                 IOException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoManager
        Method to verify a certificate that has the signers public key inside the certificate, i.e if SignerInfoType is self, certificate or certificate_chain

        For other types use verifyCertificate(Certificate, Certificate)

        Important: this method only verifies the signature of the signer info public key (and for certificate_chain only the certificate above, not the entire chain). It doesn't check any of the validation requirements or against trust store.

        Specified by:
        verifyCertificate in interface CryptoManager
        Parameters:
        certificate - the certificate to verify.
        Returns:
        true if certificate verifies.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if supplied arguments was invalid.
        SignatureException - if internal problems occurred verifying the signature.
        IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.
        See Also:
        CryptoManager.verifyCertificate(Certificate)

                        EccPoint publicKey)
                          throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                 SignatureException,
                                 IOException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoManager
        Method used to verify a ITS Certificate data structure given the message with a given signers public key. Important: this method only verifies the signature of the signer info public key. It doesn't check any of the validation requirements or against trust store.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • verifySecuredMessage

        public void verifySecuredMessage(SecuredMessage message)
                          throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                 InvalidITSSignatureException,
                                 SignatureException,
                                 IOException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoManager
        Method used to verify a ITS secure message that contains a signer info of type certificate, for certificate_digest_with_ecdsap256 it needed to use the alternative verifySecureMessage function and supplying the related certificate. Important: this method only verifies the signature of the signer info public key. It doesn't check any of the validation requirements or against trust store.
        Specified by:
        verifySecuredMessage in interface CryptoManager
        Parameters:
        message - the signed message to verify
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if supplied arguments was invalid.
        InvalidITSSignatureException - if signature of message coundn't be verified.
        SignatureException - if internal problems occurred verifying the signature.
        IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.
        See Also:
        CryptoManager.verifySecuredMessage(SecuredMessage)

      • verifyAndDecryptSecuredMessage

        public SecuredMessage verifyAndDecryptSecuredMessage(SecuredMessage message,
                                            Certificate receiverCertificate,
                                            PrivateKey receiverKey)
                                              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                     InvalidITSSignatureException,
                                                     GeneralSecurityException,
                                                     IOException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoManager
        Method used to verify and decrypt a ITS secure message that contains a signer info of type certificate, for certificate_digest_with_ecdsap256 it needed to use the alternative verifySecureMessage function and supplying the related certificate. The method also decrypts all payloads of type signed_and_encrypted. Important: this method only verifies the signature of the signer info public key. It doesn't check any of the validation requirements or against trust store.
        Specified by:
        verifyAndDecryptSecuredMessage in interface CryptoManager
        Parameters:
        message - the signed message to verify and decrypt
        receiverCertificate - the certificate for the private key used for decryption.
        receiverKey - the private key used to decrypt the message.
        Returns:
        the secure message with all signed_and_encrypted payloads decrypted.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if supplied arguments was invalid.
        InvalidITSSignatureException - if signature of message coundn't be verified.
        SignatureException - if internal problems occurred verifying the signature.
        IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.
        GeneralSecurityException
        See Also:
        CryptoManager.verifyAndDecryptSecuredMessage(SecuredMessage, Certificate, PrivateKey)

      • verifyAndDecryptSecuredMessage

        public SecuredMessage verifyAndDecryptSecuredMessage(SecuredMessage message,
                                            Certificate signerCert,
                                            Certificate receiverCertificate,
                                            PrivateKey receiverKey)
                                              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                     InvalidITSSignatureException,
                                                     GeneralSecurityException,
                                                     IOException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoManager
        Method used to verify a ITS secure message against a given certificate. The method also decrypts all payloads of type signed_and_encrypted. Important: this method only verifies the signature of the signer info public key. It doesn't check any of the validation requirements or against trust store.
        Specified by:
        verifyAndDecryptSecuredMessage in interface CryptoManager
        Parameters:
        message - the signed message to verify and decrypt.
        signerCert - the certificate signing the message.
        receiverCertificate - the certificate for the private key used for decryption.
        receiverKey - the private key used to decrypt the message.
        Returns:
        the secure message with all signed_and_encrypted payloads decrypted.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if supplied arguments was invalid.
        InvalidITSSignatureException - if signature of message coundn't be verified.
        SignatureException - if internal problems occurred verifying the signature.
        IOException - if communication problems occurred with underlying components.
        GeneralSecurityException
        See Also:
        CryptoManager.verifyAndDecryptSecuredMessage(SecuredMessage, Certificate, Certificate, PrivateKey)

      • encodeEccPoint

        public EccPoint encodeEccPoint(PublicKeyAlgorithm alg,
                      EccPointType type,
                      PublicKey publicKey)
                        throws IllegalArgumentException,
                               InvalidKeySpecException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoManager
        Help method used to convert a public key to a EccPoint data structure.
        Specified by:
        encodeEccPoint in interface CryptoManager
        Parameters:
        alg - the public key algorithm scheme to use.
        type - the type of ECCPoint to create.
        publicKey - the related public key to convert.
        Returns:
        a converted EccPoint data structure encoded according the the given ECC point type.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if public key was invalid or unsupported
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the given public key contained invalid parameters related to the specified public key algorithm.
        See Also:
        CryptoManager.encodeEccPoint(PublicKeyAlgorithm, EccPointType, PublicKey)

        public Object decodeEccPoint(PublicKeyAlgorithm alg,
                    EccPoint point)
                      throws InvalidKeySpecException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoManager
        Help method to decode a EccPoint to a EccPublic key or ECFieldElement depending on the type of EccPoint.
        Specified by:
        decodeEccPoint in interface CryptoManager
        Parameters:
        alg - related public key algorithm.
        point - the ecc point to decode
        Returns:
        If EccPointType is not x_coordinate_only will only a BigInteger representing the ecdsa signature 'r' value, otherwise a PublicKey
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - if problems occurred decoding the key.
        See Also:
        CryptoManager.decodeEccPoint(PublicKeyAlgorithm, EccPoint)

      • digest

        public byte[] digest(byte[] message,
            PublicKeyAlgorithm alg)
              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                     NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Description copied from interface: CryptoManager
        Method to generate a digest of a message using the given public key algorithm scheme.
        Specified by:
        digest in interface CryptoManager
        Parameters:
        message - the message data to generate a digest from.
        alg - the related public key algorithm scheme to use.
        Returns:
        a digest of the message.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an unsupported public key algorithm scheme was given.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if related cryptographic algorithm wasn't available in JVM.
        See Also:
        CryptoManager.digest(byte[], PublicKeyAlgorithm)

      • eCEISEncryptSymmetricKey

        protected EciesNistP256EncryptedKey eCEISEncryptSymmetricKey(PublicKeyAlgorithm publicKeyAlgorithm,
                                                 PublicKey encryptionKey,
                                                 Key symmetricKey)
                                                      throws InvalidKeyException,
                                                             InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                                             IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                                             BadPaddingException,
                                                             IllegalArgumentException,
                                                             InvalidKeySpecException,
                                                             IOException
        Help method to perform a ECIES encryption to a recipient of a symmetric key.
        Parameters:
        publicKeyAlgorithm - the algorithm used.
        encryptionKey - the public encryption key of the recipient
        symmetricKey - the symmetric key to encrypt
        Returns:
        a EciesNistP256EncryptedKey to be included in a SecureMessage header.
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if supplied key was corrupt.
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if algorithm was badly specified.
        IllegalBlockSizeException - if encrypted data was corrupt.
        BadPaddingException - if encrypted data was corrupt.
        IllegalArgumentException - if arguments where invalid or algorithm not supported.
        InvalidKeySpecException - if supplied key specification was faulty.
        IOException - if communication problem occurred with underlying systems.

      • eCEISDecryptSymmetricKey

                                       InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                       IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                       BadPaddingException,
                                       IllegalArgumentException,
                                       InvalidKeySpecException,
                                       IOException

        Returns:
        a decrypted symmetric key.
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException - if supplied key was corrupt.
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if algorithm was badly specified.
        IllegalBlockSizeException - if encrypted data was corrupt.
        BadPaddingException - if encrypted data was corrupt.
        IllegalArgumentException - if arguments where invalid or algorithm not supported.
        InvalidKeySpecException - if supplied key specification was faulty.
        IOException - if communication problem occurred with underlying systems.

      • symmetricEncrypt

        protected byte[] symmetricEncrypt(SymmetricAlgorithm symmetricAlgorithm,
                      byte[] data,
                      Key symmetricKey,
                      byte[] nounce)
                           throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                  NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                  IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                  BadPaddingException,
                                  InvalidKeyException,
                                  InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                  NoSuchProviderException,
                                  NoSuchPaddingException
        Help method to perform a symmetric encrypt of data.
        Parameters:
        symmetricAlgorithm - the algorithm used to encrypt the data.
        data - the encrypted data.
        symmetricKey - the encrypt key.
        nounce - related nounce.
        Returns:
        the encrypt clear text data.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if arguments where invalid or algorithm not supported.
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algorithm isn't available in underlying provider.
        IllegalBlockSizeException - if encrypted data was corrupt.
        BadPaddingException - if encrypted data was corrupt.
        InvalidKeyException - if supplied key was corrupt.
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if algorithm was badly specified.
        NoSuchProviderException - if underlying provider was't installed properly.
        NoSuchPaddingException - if encrypted data was corrupt.

      • addHeader

             HeaderField headerField)
        Method that adds a header field in a sorted order depending on header field type value.

        headerField - header to add.

      • findHeader

        protected HeaderField findHeader(SecuredMessage secureMessage,
                     HeaderFieldType type,
                     boolean required)
                          throws IllegalArgumentException
        Help method to find a specific header field in a secure message.
        Parameters:
        secureMessage - the secure message to lookup header fields.
        type - the type of header to find
        required - if exception should be thrown if header could be found.
        Returns:
        header field of specified type, or null if no header field could be found and it's not required.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no required header field of specified type could be found.
